item.title: specific sound (not speech) detection?
item.dc:creator: FLVR
item.description:
I apologize if my question is too general for this forum, however I thought I’d give it a shot.

Politepix managed to create an intelligence that detects and recognizes speech to text. Meaning it is able to input words to its system.

Also it is known that Siri nowadays supports Asian languages such as Cantonese, Mandarin, Korean

Words are just a bunch sounds… I am wondering, then, if there is an intelligence that detects specific sounds that are not “words” (ex. clap sound, whistle sound, breathing sound).

So far all I found are frameworks or SDK’s that are based on decibel sensitivity.

Truly Appreciate any feedback or reference.

item.title: Reply To: specific sound (not speech) detection?
item.dc:creator: Halle Winkler
item.description:
Welcome,

Sorry, I’m not aware of any frameworks which do that.
